title.narrative: Africa Programme for Peace, Phase IV

description.narrative: The APP is aimed at strengthening the African Union (AU) and selected Regional Economic Communities (RECs) within the area of peace, security and democratic governance.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Capacities of Member States to delimit, demarcate and manage borders strengthened

Number of Member States have a National Border Commission Number of Cross-Border Cooperation (CBC) at continental, regional and local levels and strengthened border governance capabilities of RECs/RMs and member states (2022-2023)

target.value: 8 Member States have a National Border Commission

actual.value: 4 Member States have National Border Commission

target.value: 8 Member States have a National Border Commission

actual.value: 4 Member States have National Border Commission.

target.value: 8 Member States have a National Border Commission.

actual.value: 6 Member States have National Border Commission.

target.value: 6 Member States have a National Border Commission

actual.value: Joint Border Commission and JPSM meetings of Sudan and South Sudan were held in 2021. In addition, needs assessment was conducted to identify the capacity gaps and recommendations to support Sierra Leone. JTC meeting was also held between Burundi, DRC, Tanzania,and Zambia in 2021. In addition, JTC meeting was held between Uganda and South Sudan. A tripartite Technical Boundary Committee Meeting between Kenya, South Soudan and Uganda were conducted during the reporting period.

target.value: 5 Cross-Border Cooperation (CBC) at continental, regional and local levels established 4 strengthened border governance capabilities of RECs/RMs and member states
5 Cross-Border Cooperation (CBC) at continental, regional and local levels established 5 strengthened border governance capabilities of RECs/RMs and member states

title.narrative: Enhanced capacity of the AU to effectively deploy and conduct preventive diplomacy and mediation (direct prevention)

Existence of coherent & effective arrangements for preventive diplomacy & mediation missions led by AU
From 2022 to 2023: 1) Number of meetings of the inter-departmental task force on preventive diplomacy and mediation 2) Number of joint AU-RECS/RMs guidance documents for assessments, analysis, information sharing and coordination of preventive diplomacy and mediation interventions 3) Number of preventive diplomacy and mediation missions undertaken by the Special Envoys, High Representatives and the Panel of the Wise and its subsidiary mechanisms 4) Number of High-Level Seminars on thematic issues related to peace and security held for the Special Envoys, High Representatives, and members of the Panel of the Wise and subsidiary mechanisms

target.value: Review of AU preventative diplomacy & mediation arrangements leading to their update

actual.value: - Review of AU PSOs in the 2020 narrative report: These include AMISOM, MNJTF, UNAMID, and missions in Burundi and Gambia - Review of AMISOM and negotiations in the PSC on a post-2021 AMISOM, endorsement of a multidimensional mission with the UN and call for negotiations on this option - Field mission in Somalia in November 2021 to meet with stakeholders on future of AMISOM - Multinational Joint-Task Force in the Lake Chad Basin had its mandate extended to 31 January 2022, review and continued implementation - AU-UN Mission Hybrid Operations in Darfur ended on 31 December 2020, drawdown and withdrawal scheduled until 30 June 2021 - AU Human Rights Observers and Military Experts Mission in Burundi ends in May 2021 due to achieved progress.

target.value: 100% of PSC mandated preventative diplomacy and mediation missions undertaken

actual.value: 100% of PSC mandated missions are undertaken AMISOM Mandate renewed for a period of 12 months from 27 May 2020 [at PSC's 923rd meeting] - expiring on 27 May 2021. G5-Sahel Mandate renewed for a period of twelve (12) months, starting from 13 July 2020 [at PSC's 939th meeting] -expiring on 13 July 2021UNAMID Mandate extended up to 31 December 2020 [at PSC's 927th meeting]PSC authorizing the deployment of the African Union Military Observers Mission to the Central African Republic (MOUACA). The PSC endorsed the deployment of MOUACA for the period from 1 September 2020 to 31 October 2022.

target.value: MSU is fully staffed and operational (2012 SOP is implemented)

actual.value: MSU is fully operational and has the adequate staff

target.value: 1) Number of meetings of the inter-departmental task force on preventive diplomacy and mediation: Four meeting 2) Number of joint AU-RECS/RMs guidance documents for assessments, analysis, information sharing and coordination of preventive diplomacy and mediation interventions : One guidance document 3) Number of preventive diplomacy and mediation missions undertaken by the Special Envoys, High Representatives and the Panel of the Wise and its subsidiary mechanisms: Four missions 4) Number of High-Level Seminars on thematic issues related to peace and security held for the Special Envoys, High Representatives, and members of the Panel of the Wise and subsidiary mechanisms:2 seminars

1) Number of meetings of the inter-departmental task force on preventive diplomacy and mediation : 5 meetings 2) Number of joint AU-RECS/RMs guidance documents for assessments, analysis, information sharing and coordination of preventive diplomacy and mediation interventions: 2 Guidance documents 3) Number of preventive diplomacy and mediation missions undertaken by the Special Envoys, High Representatives and the Panel of the Wise and its subsidiary mechanisms: 5 missions 4) Number of High-Level Seminars on thematic issues related to peace and security held for the Special Envoys, High Representatives, and members of the Panel of the Wise and subsidiary mechanisms: 3 seminars
Funding mechanism(s) established for preventative diplomacy and mediation missions

actual.value: The Peace Fund is expected to enable the AU to fully finance mediation and preventive diplomacy activities, institutional readiness and capacity, maintain a crisis reserve facility as well as meet its commitment to finance 25% of its peace operations budget

title.narrative: More effective, coordinated and timely direct and structural prevention of conflicts and crises by the AU

1. Timeliness of direct conflict prevention interventions by AU 2. Extent to which conflict prevention interventions (direct and structural) are informed by systematic joint early warning and analysis

target.value: 1. AU decision-making for preventative actions responds to urgent crisis situations in 90% of cases 2. AU preventative mechanisms (PoW. PoW Secretariat. MSU. AULOs etc.) are informed by joint early warning & analysis. fully staffed and funded.
